Why do my antivirus software Avast and Kaspersky flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Your antivirus software may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it includes mining software, which could potentially be exploited by third parties to misuse your computer's resources. This is a false positive warning, and you can review the resources provided to learn more about it.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.
To find out more about the false positives, review the following resources:
https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/
https://www.kaspersky.com/blog/not-a-virus/18015/
# Notable Changes
* Enable optional VRSC or VRSCTEST chains as parent of an ID. For example, bob@ is equivalent to `bob.vrsc@` or, on testnet, `bob.vrsctest@`
* Update stratum protocol for mining to include solution information for miner, which enables smooth autoswitch and prepares for PBaaS merge mining
* Minor issues, including listidentities issue on Mac and compatibility with pool mining, even on block numbers under 16 to prepare for PBaaSThis release includes activation support for VerusID, and relative adjustment to the CPU and FPGA-equalizing VerusHash 2.1 Algorithm**AT BLOCK 800200, THE VERUS MAINNET PROTOCOL WILL HARDFORK, AND THIS UPDATE IS MANDATORY TO REMAIN ON THE VERUS MAINNET. What changes were made to the Verus software in the latest release?

Notable changes in this release include:

1. The ability to enable optional VRSC or VRSCTEST chains as a parent of an ID.
2. An update to the stratum protocol for mining to include solution information for miners, enabling smooth autoswitch and preparing for PBaaS merge mining.
3. Minor issue fixes, including a listidentities issue on Mac and compatibility with pool mining.

Avast and Kaspersky may flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP". These are warnings that you are installing mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC.

https://blog.malwarebytes.com/detections/pup-optional-bitcoinminer/

What is the importance of the Verus mainnet protocol update, and what happens if I don't upgrade?

This update is mandatory to remain on the Verus mainnet. If you don't upgrade, you may need to resynchronize the blockchain if you are running in native mode. The Verus mainnet protocol will hardfork at block 800200, and this update is necessary to ensure a smooth transition.

What are VerusIDs, and what benefits do they provide?

VerusIDs are a fully functional blockchain protocol, not just an ID system. They provide plenty of opportunities for identity applications and are not controlled by a corporation, unlike most blockchain ID implementations. VerusIDs offer benefits such as revocability, recoverability, privacy, full decentralization, and quantum-ready friendly crypto addresses on the Verus worldwide network.
